content: Who was the founder of the Rock Band at ACDZ?
The founder of the rock band at ACDZ is not specified in your prompt. Could you please provide more information or clarify your question?

The Australian rock band AC/DC was formed by brothers Malcolm and Angus Young in Sydney in 1973. They were later joined by vocalist Bon Scott, bassist Mark Evans, and drummer Phil Rudd to complete the lineup.

AC/DC has had numerous hit songs throughout their career. One of their biggest hits and most iconic songs is "Back in Black," which was released in 1980 and became a worldwide rock anthem. It is often considered their signature song and one of the best-selling rock songs of all time.
How popular was ACDC in their prime relative to other rock bands?

AC/DC was incredibly popular in their prime and remains one of the most influential and beloved rock bands of all time. During the 1970s and 1980s, they achieved significant success with albums like "Highway to Hell" (1979) and "Back in Black" (1980), which solidified their status as one of the biggest rock bands in the world. AC/DC's music and high-energy performances resonated with fans, and their unique blend of hard rock and blues made them stand out among their peers. They have sold over 200 million records worldwide and continue to attract new generations of fans with their timeless rock anthems.
